Author: phm87#7395
Content:
I read that code of ac params for n, k and pers string is developed but do you plan to add other algos ?
I don't want to talk which algo is the best but I think that some coins may want to become an assetchain but keeping their algo (whatever their reason is).
Maybe adding more possible algos as ac params requires way more work that I can imagine so sorry if the question is stupid

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it requires adding support for each new hashalgo. I will accept a pull request for a sane method to handle many different mining algos

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @phm87 if you make a patch for adding progpow, that is likely to be merged

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: other weirdo algos, maybe not

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and it needs to be done in a good way, not making the current internals harder to maintain

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I don't think that I have the competencies to do it but I understand what you mean. I was not thinking about weird unknown algos but I was thinking about sha256 as example or script

Author: phm87#7395
Content: Thank you

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @phm87 didn't even think of adding sha256d as an option, but it might be nice for "completeness", to allow people to use btc asics on their AC's, instead of ZEC asic's

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i don't think it would be used much, to be honest

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: but if we had ProgPOW as an option, dozens of coins are thinking about migrating to that

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I don't know, I'm new to Komodo ecosystem so I really don't know which kind of coins asks KMD team to have dpow

Author: phm87#7395
Content: thank you for your insider's infos ^^

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: if a small new coin starts

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and decides to use SHA256D, then an immense amount of hashpower in the world can switch to the network at any time, causing havoc

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: hence, small coins don't use sha256d

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the same thing happened with equihash 200,9

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: if you have DPoW to protect you, the problems are much less

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: https://github.com/daira/r1cs/blob/master/zkproofs.pdf

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: new slides about designing zero-knowledge proofs

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: https://saplingwoodchipper.github.io/

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
Hi @dukeleto üëã
Would it be difficult for a competent dev to add  SHA256D as an algo, as you were discussing above?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: blackjok8r already added a new hashing algo

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the first step is to make a table driven way to specify new algo

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: once that is in place, then it would be a matter to just make new table entries and link in the hash function for each algo

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Thanks a lot!

Author: phm87#7395
Content: @Ondalf  üòÆ I didn't know that blackjok3r already added a new algo, it is super cool

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Technically miket added most of it, I just finished it off... The way its done is silly and messy. It works but for adding mroe algos we need somehting better, like james suggested above

Content: https://codaprotocol.com/blog/snark-challenge.html `Coda Protocol, CoinList, and DeKrypt are partnering to launch a $100k global public research challenge to dramatically speed up zk-SNARKs. We expect the contest to produce huge advancements in the state of the art. We‚Äôll be contributing all of those advancements back to the public domain with a permissive open-source license that allows them to be used by the broader crypto ecosystem.`

Author: Alright#0419
Content: vaguely remember there being a way to make block 1 not mined to ac_pubkey/ac_script. Does anyone know how to do this?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Alright where would it go, otherwise?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: to miner of block 1

Author: Alright#0419
Content: anywhere miner specifies

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: maybe if -ac_supply=0

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it just goes to where-ever

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: but otherwise, block 1 is pre-mine

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I have a problem in that I told ZEX I'd do a airdrop/snapshot to a new POS chain, but block 1 is mined to ac_pubkey, so I can't distribute the airdrop on the new chain without having ac_pubkey privkey(which I don't want to ever have)

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: interesting

Author: Alright#0419
Content: and getting the person that does have the key to sign a raw tx has been a hassle

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: maybe we need a new -ac_ param to deal with this

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: bbiab, ENO‚òï

Content: I know there is was a way to accomplish this, just can't for the life of me remember how

Author: Alright#0419
Content: have to check the code, I think there's an exception to let block 1 go anywhere somewhere

Content: not focused on it atm though
